OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE

TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE

1.- Obtain census of population for a stated area
(say two miles or within two miles of high water line)
(In this would suggest uniforming. see card attached,)

2. - Blood index for this population (The card for the
census and blood index could be made one and
the same. This is essential to determine effectiveness
of Antimalarial precautionary measures.

3- Biological survey of all streams and ponds to be brought
into the pond on close relationship thereto. This
to determine the so-called plankton present and
their probable relation to mosquito (anopheles)
breeding and to compare with changes effected
by the dam. (?)

4(5- Careful search of the land and water areas
to bet be flooded in order to locate and des-
troy any aquatic vegetation which will be-
come dangerous from standpoint of mosquito
breeding after lake is made. Such vegetation
as “silver grass” ( ), lillies, ________
(Birmingham growth) etc. Permanent markers should
be placed to easily locate after lake is made.

OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE

TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE

4.- Chemical Analyses of water in flooded area-
especially the main stream. This for comparisons
to be made with the lake water afterwards.
[Recall the hydrogen sulphid odor of the Warrior
at the dam in fall, and the Clear Short Creek.
at-classified supposedly from Alum.]

5- Whatever rights that may be necessary for install-
ing suitable screens to prevent floatage from
entering lake from affluent streams at times
of high water. [some means of properly “walling”
these streams should be worked out -- probably
by strong fencing wire or the like.

6- Indiate on maps by proper characters the
kind of timber skirting banks?
